results.title: Tibet: the lost mystery
results.brief_description: The first of a two part documentary that examines the mysterious story of Tibet. It is the story of a country unseen by Europeans until early this century, of its destruction by invading Chinese in 1950 and the flight into India of the Dalai Lama with 100,000 Tibetans.
results.description: The first of a two part documentary that examines the mysterious story of Tibet. It is the story of a country unseen by Europeans until early this century, of its destruction by invading Chinese in 1950 and the flight into India of the Dalai Lama with 100,000 Tibetans.

results.title: Tibet: a personal report
results.creator_credit: Anne Greene, Elena Greene and Felix Greene
results.brief_description: Records the conditions of life in precommunist Tibet as well as the fascinating life and activities of the people today. Shows not only the towns but the vast wind swept grasslands, 16,000 feet above sea level, where many Tibetans still live as nomads.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Greene, Elena Greene and Felix Greene

results.title: Ti-Jean in the land of iron
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Leonard Forest and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: No challenge, no obstacle is too great for ten-year-old Ti-Jean. As in his other exploits, he proves equal to every situation. Working his boat passage, flying an aircraft, saving a mine from disaster—all are in a day’s work for him before he again mounts his white horse and rides off in search of new adventures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raymond Garceau, Leonard Forest and ONF | NFB

results.title: Ti-Jean goes west
results.brief_description: The Canadian prairies, seen through the eyes of a ten-year-old boy. Ti-Jean reaches the Golden West and hires out as a harvest hand. he learns to handle the equipment; he learns about the life of prairie farmers and, when a storm threatens, he works with the strength of ten to save a farmer’s crop.

results.title: Ti-Jean goes lumbering [B&W]
results.brief_description: A French-Canadian folk tale about the fantastic exploits of a mysterious little boy who one day rides into a winter logging camp on a big white horse. Ti-Jean’s feats dwarf those of even the hardiest lumberjack as he fells timber, cuts, carries and piles heavy logs and comes out the victor in every contest. The film portrays typical life and work in a Canadian logging camp.

results.title: Thus spake Richard Strauss
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander and CBS Telelvision Network
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein narrates and conducts a performance of Richard Strauss’s “Thus spake Zarathustra”, a tone poem, based on the work by the German philosopher, Friedrich Nietzsche. Bernstein discusses the eight sections of the tone poem and shows how their philosophical content is expressed by the musical structure. Features the New York Philharmonic orchestra.

results.title: Thursday's children
results.creator_credit: Guy Brenton, Lindsay Anderson, Morse Films and World Wide
results.brief_description: Academy award winning documentary by Lindsay Anderson and Guy Brenton about the problem of educating children who are born deaf, and stresses the mutual trust and spontaneity of expression that deafness gives these children in compensation. Narrated by Sir Richard Burton, the Royal School for the Deaf in Margate is used to demonstrate how children must first be introduced to the idea of words, understand when words are spoken and to reproduce sounds they cannot hear. A masterpiece of sensitivity and dignity.

results.title: Thunderbirds in China
results.creator_credit: Les Rose, Donald Brittain and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Young Vancouver hockey players, the University of British Columbia Thunderbirds, undertake to show their skills to the new teams of China. It is a journey that takes them far into that vast country and to an understanding of East and West. Hockey in China still has far to go, but this film leaves no doubt that the Chinese players and fans are alive to the challenge. A film of fresh insight and discovery for all audiences, whether hockey-minded or not.

results.title: Thumpalong
results.creator_credit: Peter Nicholson, Australian Film Commission and Peter Nicholson Productions
results.brief_description: Using vibrant colours, this hand drawn animated film by Peter Nicholson tells the story about an old king who hates music, and a wonderous character called Thumpalong, who is an amazing “One Man Band”.
